alert.note: Alert for Central La Paz; Kofa; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 2:59PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central La Paz, northeastern Yuma and Maricopa Counties through 345 PM MST... At 259 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 22 miles south of Vicksburg Junction, or 40 miles west of Tonopah, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. Areas of blowing dust possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central La Paz, northeastern Yuma and Maricopa Counties. This includes AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 65 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central La Paz; Kofa; Tonopah Desert
